page.title: 05North Tregony 2
page.content: Tregony has its own cricket and football teams and a four acre sports field complete with pavillion. The Women's Institute and Children's Playgroup are also very active. In the summer many people let their homes to holiday makers; there is quite a high demand since the village is relatively unspoilt and gives easy access to the Roseland peninsular. Tregony was founded in the eleventh century around the time of the original Domesday Book. There were then only a few houses on the banks of the river Fal. At the height of its influence and prosperity it was a thriving port and, being one of the notorious "rotten boroughs", sent two M.P.s to Westminster in the 1820s. There was much trade with the French ports, dealing in tin, wool and food- stuffs. Local trades have almost gone.
